channel.title: CVE Feed for croixhaug -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for croixhaug -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-2764|2024-08-02T06:33:05.391Z -- croixhaug -- interactive%20image%20map%20plugin%20%E2%80%93%20draw%20attention
item.description: The Draw Attention plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the ajax_set_featured_image function in versions up to, and including, 2.0.11. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level permissions and above, to change the featured image of arbitrary posts with an image that exists in the media library.

item.title: CVE-2024-4288|2024-08-01T20:33:53.168Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘link’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 1.6.7.14 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1760|2024-08-01T18:48:22.006Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.6.20. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ssa_factory_reset() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-1760|2024-03-06T05:33:23.300Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.6.20. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ssa_factory_reset() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-4288|2024-06-06T19:48:10.334Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘link’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 1.6.7.14 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2341|2024-06-04T17:30:28.953Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the keys parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.7.7 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2024-2342|2024-06-04T17:29:23.691Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the customer_id parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.7.7 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2024-1760|2024-06-24T15:00:13.904Z -- croixhaug -- appointment%20booking%20calendar%20%E2%80%94%20simply%20schedule%20appointments%20booking%20plugin
item.description: The Appointment Booking Calendar — Simply Schedule Appointments Booking Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.6.20. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ssa_factory_reset() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
